required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Hemostatic Agent to Suture in Terms of Hemostatic Function and Preservation of Ovarian Function
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Randomized, Investigator-initiated Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy of PRreservation of ovArian Function, Hemostasis, and sAfety of a Hemostatic Agent Versus Suturing During Laparoscopic Ovarian Cystectomy for Endometrioma

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the efficacy of preservation of ovarian function, hemostasis, and safety of a hemostatic agent versus suturing during laparoscopic ovarian cystectomy for ovarian endometriosis.

detailed_description.textblock:
In women with endometrioma who plan to undergo laparoscopic ovarian cystectomy, surgical technique can influence postoperative ovarian function because of removal of normal ovarian tissue with ovarian cyst and damage to ovarian tissue during bleeding control after stripping of endometrioma. This study is designed to compare hemostatic sealant to suturing in terms of hemostatic function, safety and preservation of ovarian function.
Ovarian function of all patients will be evaluated on pre op, post op 12 weeks, post op 48 weeks by measuring AMH and ovarian volume. And Hemostatic function will be evaluated by measuring serum hemoglobin, blood loss during operation, etc.

primary_outcome.measure: Ovarian function preservation 12 weeks after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Reduction rate of AMH level in serum 12 weeks after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Ovarian function preservation 48 weeks after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Reduction rate of AMH level in serum 48 weeks after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: The time required to finish hemostasis
secondary_outcome.description: Stop-watch will be operated right after finishing stripping endometrioma. It will be evaluated how long the time have been spent for bleeding control

secondary_outcome.measure: the success rate of hemostasis within 10 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Stop-watch will be operated right after finishing stripping endometrioma. It will be evaluated whether hemostasis is finished within 10 minutes
The volume of blood loss will be estimated by using simple visual assessment technique referring to gauze count and irrigation bottle
Change of serum hemoglobin from baseline
whether patients are transfused during admission period

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse events associated with operation, bleeding or transfusion
secondary_outcome.description: any adverse events during admission period
days from admission day to discharge day
time from anesthesia start to delivery of patient to recovery room

arm_group.description: During laparoscopic ovarian cystectomy, bleeding will be controlled by using a hemostatic agent (EVICEL® Fibrin Sealant, Ethicon, USA), which consist of thrombin and coagulating proteins, mainly fibrinogen and fibronectin. If hemostasis is not fulfilled enough by using it, a additional intervention such as electrocoagulation with bipolar forceps and barbed suture is required to stop bleeding.

During operation, barbed suture will be applied to the inner surface of ovarian parenchyme where ovarian endometriosis was attached. In this group, if bleeding is continued after suturing, additional electrocoagulation with bipolar forceps will be conducted.

intervention.intervention_name: Hemostatic agent (EVICEL®) application during laparoscopic ovarian cystectomy
intervention.description: During laparoscopic ovarian cystectomy, bleeding will be controlled by using a hemostatic agent (EVICEL®)

intervention.intervention_name: suturing with barbed sutures during laparoscopic ovarian cystectomy
intervention.description: During laparoscopic ovarian cystectomy, suturing of ovarian inner surface will be conducted to stop bleeding

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed consent.
- Age: 19-45 year-old women
- American Society of Anesthesiologists Physical Status classification 1 or 2
- Plan of laparoscopic ovarian cystectomy for unilateral or bilateral ovarian endometriosis diagnosed by ultrasonography
- Regular menstruation every 21-45 days
Exclusion Criteria:
- No 'ovarian' endometriosis
- Suspicious disease of ovarian malignancy
- Age: 18 and younger, 46 and older
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding.
- Lower than 0.05 ng/ml of serum Anti-mullerian hormone level
- Hormonal therapy within recent 3 months
- Considered as inappropriate by the researcher's judgment.
